fields.name: client_feedback_header
fields.help_text_en:
Client feedback surveys provide an opportunity for clients to give feedback on the services they received and key information to help your organization identify what is working well, possible challenges, and what needs to be improved in terms of service delivery.
The Client Feedback Survey can be given at case closure, when 
- Survivors needs have been met as described in the Case Action Plan
- Survivors needs have been met to the extent possible
- Survivor requests to close the case

The completion of a Client Feedback Survey should be voluntary and is anonymous. It is a means to elicit feedback on services to improve programming. In contexts where survivors may only seek services once, your organization may decide to use the Client Feedback form at the end of the first session, if it is feasible to do so.

In contexts where survivors receive services for longer periods of time, you can also consider administering client feedback surveys more frequently (e.g. on a monthly or quarterly basis).
The process for using them with a survivor should be as follows:

(1) Explain to the person that the purpose is for you and your organization to improve your services, and that their feedback is valued. 
(2) Inform the person that the information will remain anonymous and that it will not impact the services they currently receive or may need in the future. And ultimately, it is their choice as to whether they complete the survey. 
(3) A different caseworker, supervisor or other relevant staff member should be the one who gives the survey to the person and collects it from them at the end. For literate clients, this can be done independently through a paper form or an electronic form (handheld device) in which the person does not have to provide their name, just the name of the caseworker with whom they worked.

fields.name: client_feedback_date
fields.display_name_en: Date when feedback was provided by survivor

fields.name: client_feedback_administered_by
fields.help_text_en:
Instructions for staff:
-Identify who on your team is going to administer the feedback form. Identify whether it will be done in writing (giving the person the questionnaire to complete themselves) or whether a staff member will ask the questions and record the persons answers.
-Inform the person that you will ask them some questions but will not write their name on the form and that the interview will remain anonymous.
-Explain the purpose. Say: 'This questionnaire is voluntary and confidential. Its purpose is to collect information about the services that have been provided to you and to help make improvements in the quality of care that GBV survivors receive in this community.'
-Remind the person that you will not ask them any questions about their actual case, but are just interested in the services they received throughout the case management process. 
-Get consent to proceed or if the person declines, tell the person that it is ok and if they change their minds they can contact you.

gbv_sexual_violence_type
fields.guiding_questions_en:
The six core types of GBV and their definitions are:

                1. Rapenon-consensual penetration (however slight) of the vagina, anus or mouth with a penis or other body part. Also includes non-consensual penetration of the vagina or anus with an object. Examples can include but are not limited to: gang rape, marital rape, sodomy, forced oral sex. This type of GBV does not include attempted rape since no penetration has occurred.

                2. Sexual Assaultany form of non-consensual sexual contact that does not result in or include penetration. Examples can include but are not limited to: attempted rape, unwanted kissing, unwanted stroking, unwanted touching of breasts, genitalia and buttocks, and female genital cutting / mutilation. This type of GBV does not include rape since rape involves penetration.

                3. Physical Assaultphysical violence that is not sexual in nature. Examples can include but are not limited to: hitting, slapping, choking, cutting, shoving, burning, shooting or use of any weapons, acid attacks or any other act that results in physical pain, discomfort or injury. This type of GBV does not include female genital cutting / mutilation, or honor killing.

                4. Forced Marriagethe marriage of an individual against her or his will.

                5. Denial of Resources, Opportunities or Servicesdenial of rightful access to economic resources/assets or livelihood opportunities, education, health or other social services. Examples can include but are not limited to: a widow prevented from receiving an inheritance, earnings taken by an intimate partner or family member, a woman prevented from using contraceptives, a girl prevented from attending school, etc. This type of GBV does not include reports of general poverty.

                6. Psychological/Emotional Abuseinfliction of mental or emotional pain or injury. Examples can include but are not limited to: threats of physical or sexual violence, intimidation, humiliation, forced isolation, stalking, verbal harassment, unwanted attention, remarks, gestures or written words of a sexual and/or menacing nature, destruction of cherished things, etc.

lookup_values_en.display_text: Arrange meeting of lawyer with family for testimony preparation
Counselling from Children First or any other external agency
Opening bank account; follow-up for completion of documents  such as Aadhar Card; Pan Card, Voter Identity Card;  filling up of application forms etc. to avail financial benefits
Follow-up on availing social security schemes
Work with IO to ensure co-operation
Some medical Ailments that existed before abuse (with reasons)
Follow-up status of charge sheet filed with IO
Arrange meeting of lawyer with family for testimony preparation
Inform child / family about Court Hearing / Summon etc.
Coordinate for meeting of Counsellor with family/Child.
Case Discussion With CWC, Children First, TFI, Family/Child/Lawyer/Any Other
Collection of Support Person Order / FIR / child's statement u/s 164 CrPC / MLC
First Interaction and immediate need assessment
Specifically going to fill Need Assessment Form
Be a change agent (Parent Support groups)
Attend meeting other than case management
Leading Overall Preparation for Training / HAQ Event
Coordination with team / Resource Persons for Training
Finalisation of Agenda for Training / HAQ Events
Inviting Participants for Training / HAQ Events
Seeking Confirmations for Trainings / HAQ Events
Organising Venue and Other Logistics for Training / HAQ Event
Support at the time of relocation
Filing application with DLSA / concerned PS
De-briefing / sharing with team ideas, issues and concerns from Conference / Workshop / Seminar
To Assist Family in Opening the
Impairment of Limbs (Any other body party)
Special Court, Patiala House (New Delhi District)
Testimony of parent / other material witnesses
Referral to DLSA for legal aid
Any school certificate of child for age proof
Bone Ossification or other medical age determination test report of child
CWC order on age determination of child
Electricity / Water / Telephone Bill of parent/guardian
Child is not going to any school/ non-formal education/ NIOS and needs assistance in getting admission or to continue in school.
Child needs tutorial support to pursuing education (as the educational performance is degrading after abuse or child has never studied before or dropped out long back)
Child is above 14 Years-Doesnt have any career aspirations. Need to have discussions to help identify skills, interests and career choices.
Child is above 14 years- Not going for any vocational training and needs assistance in getting admission

Child is feeling scared/ demotivated in school/ non formal classes/ vocational training centre (reasons may be varied- such as accused house is on the way accused is bailed out, may be facing stigma/ humiliation/ blaming in the school/ non formal education from staff, peer group etc.)
Social worker needs to follow-up to ensure that the child continues in school/non formal education/NIOS/vocational training centre.
Child has some concerns/ anxieties that can be handled by the Social Worker  (Includes the emotional support/ counselling provided during 161 statement/ 164 statement/ MLC examination etc.)
Thorough assessment to identify primary psychological needs of the child is required (to be done by Social Worker as per format and training)
Child needs counselling sessions with counsellor/ psychologist
Child/ family needs assistance from social worker for psychological/ psychiatric follow-up such as bringing the child, getting appointment etc.
Family member/s undergoing trauma after the incident. Require counselling/mental health interventions.
There is violence in the family
Mother of the child requires assistance in filling domestic violence complaint. Need to be referred/ connected to relevant agency.
Family member/s require marital counselling/assistance in getting divorce/referral services for any services  or support
Mother of child requires assistance in filling domestic violence complaint. Need to be referred/connected to relevant agency for substance abuse reduction counselling/treatment.
Mother of the child needs to be empowered to earn livelihood (esp. in incest cases)

There is an alcoholic parent in the family or a parent is addicted to drugs and other psychotropic substances. Need to be referred/ connected to relevant agency for substance abuse reduction counselling/ treatment.
Family member/survivor shows the passion to become an agent of change and assist others.
Brother; Stranger; Elder Brothers; Mothers; Father
Security guard at the place where aunt used to work as a maid
Family is struggling to bear abuse related expenses for which interim compensation is needed
IO/ DLSA/ DCW etc. have already applied for interim compensation, however follow-up is needed.
Family has received the interim compensation however its use for the childs rehabilitative purposes need to be ensured.
Survivor /Family has not yet received interim compensation, however they need money to bear the emergency needs

Survivor and/or Family member/s can avail the benefits of social security schemes such as disability benefits, Ladli yojna, old age pension, widow pension etc. Need to be referred/ connected to relevant schemes.
There is an unemployed member in the family that can be employed
Whether the child has ID proofs like Aadhar/PAN card, if not then the family needs to be informed about getting the ID proof ASAP
Social workers assistance is needed in opening bank account or getting ID proofs etc. to avail the benefits under social security schemes
One time abuse by Single Abuser
Multiple times abuse by Single Abuser
One time abuse by Multiple Abusers
Multiple times abuse by Multiple Abusers
Child was shown pornography before or at the time of abuse
Child was filmed during the Act
Child is getting threat because of MMS or Video
Pain in private parts / abdomen / infection
Child has some congenital disease; Physical or mental disability; any other medical ailment or history of medical ailment for which assistance for treatment is required
Child suffered injury or any other physical harm due to the sexual assault and requires immediate medical examination and/or care and treatment
Child needs assistance for treatment for some congenital disease; physical or mental disability; any other medical ailment that is aggravated due to the incident

Child needs assistance for treatment for some congenital disease; physical or mental disability; any other medical ailment that is likely to have having impact on the legal proceedings involving the child
There is need to take the child to a doctor as the child complains about pains, rashes, scabies, acne, blisters, menstrual disturbance, irritation/ itching in private parts or during urination etc.
It is a first response case and medico-legal examination is required
Medico-legal examination is already done, however follow-up as suggested by doctor doing medico legal examination is required
There is need for the child to undergo certain medical tests as prescribed by the doctor
There is a need for surgery for injury resulting from sexual assault e.g. colostomy and/or its follow-up as per doctors advice
There is a need for pregnancy/abortion/delivery related check-up/ its follow-up as per doctors advice
Survivor/ family doesnt have the basic case related documents such as copy of complaint, FIR, post MLC prescription etc.
Survivor/ family is facing threats/ pressures from the accused side. Need to take necessary measures to ensure protection.
Family is not getting adequate support from the police/ police is not cooperative. Need to take necessary measures to ensure police cooperation.
Social worker needs to assist in Testimony preparation, including pre-trial visit to the court
To IO for documents for family
To IO for interim compensation follow-up
To IO for production of child before CWC
To IO for follow-up on summons
To IO for reporting any threeat to or pressure on the child / family
To IO for follow-up regarding IQ test / ossification / placement of child in shelter home
To Family for Update in their case / providing documents pertaining to case
To Family for Follow-up on identified need
To Family for information regarding testimony
To Family for information regarding court hearing other than testimony
To Family for Coordinating Testimony Preparation with Lawyer
To Family for providing information regarding schemes / procedures etc. for accessing benefits under various schemes
To Family for information regarding change in lawyer / social worker / counsellor
To Family for information about not to continue the case legally.
Shelter Home for coordination regarding testimony preparation
Shelter Home for Collection of Documents
Shelter Home for production before CWC / Court
Shelter home for Follow-up on Summons
Shelter home for Follow-up on identified needs
CWC for information regarding new case
DCPU for coordination regarding appointment of Special Educator
To Lawyer for follow-up of Interim Compensation
CSA (as per different Sections of the POCSO Act and IPC)
Child in conflict with the law
Primary Care/Follow-up by social worker (After termination)
Accused could not be produced due to Shortage of police personnel.
Both defence counsel and APP not present
Both defence counsel and APP seek adjournment jointly
Complainant has not filed the documents
Defence counsel has not filed vakalatnama
PE not completed in connected matter
PW was not in the position to depose
Report was not filed by IO/SHO
Victim was not in position to depose
VWDR was not occupied by another court
Child shifted to another location outside Delhi
Family not interested in receiving HAQs services
HAQ closed because family was not cooperative
HAQ team was unable to motivate the family

Lookup.name_en: Relationship Of Child With Person Who Signed Vakalatnama

lookup_values_en.display_text: Entrusted into the care of an individual
This is an Incest case and there is a need to ensure that the child is safe in family environment and/or is not being pressurized to turn hostile. Specify, who is the abuser?

The abuser/ abusers family members live close by and interaction with the child/ childs family establishes that the abuser has influence/ power/ control on the child/ childs family and a safety plan needs to be worked out
Child/ family is getting threats/ proposals from the accused or his friends or relatives / child and family feel unsafe and require protection
Child/ siblings are presently in an unsafe/ hostile/ neglected environment and need to be placed in a shelter home through the CWC. Specify if there is a need for discussion with the family.
There is a need to have discussion with the family about placing the child/sibling in a shelter home through child Welfare committee (CWC)
There is a need to have discussion with the family regarding not blaming the child and/or being compassionate to the child
Child is in shelter home and a home study is must to assess family situation/ dynamics before restoration of the child
Child is living with family/ restored to family and home visit reports need to be submitted to CWC
There is a need to assist the survivor/ family in placing the new born child in an adoption agency
Visit to PS DCP Office SJPU
Arranging Boarding and Lodging of Family for VT
Visit to EducationDirectorate Any other Govt. Office

Lookup.name_en: Visit To Ps Dcp Office Sjpu
Yes, No, Or Drop Out After Incident
